replies.body:
(Yes my classes are very basic, get out x3)
Math: 91%
Physical Education+Health: 83% (Sadly, I'm not very active x3)
Visual Arts: 94%
Science: 82%

My grades for my other classes were great in the first quarter of the year, then I missed 2 weeks of school, making them go down quite a bit. 
Last semester:
English: 77%
French: 86%
Geography: 74% (I forgot to hand in this important essay, making my grade go down by a good 10-12%)
Business: 97% 

We do use the A/B/C/D/F grading system, along with an E/G/S/N system. With the latter, I usually get all E's, with the exception of Science, Phys. Ed., and English.

replies.body:
Thank you, Iowa High Schools, for only having really basic classes for freshmen / sophomores...

Home Maintenance: 90% (A-)
PE: 99% (A+)
Spanish II: 93% (A)
Geometry: 94% (A)
English: 74% (C)

Home Maintenance is the worst class I've ever taken, which is only exacerbated by the teacher's incompetence. It's, quite seriously, impossible to fail the class, which I like to call Construction 001, and I'm only getting a 90% because I'm terrible at hands-on work.

PE is easy, as long as you do the work.

Spanish II is awesome, and the teacher is amazing and philosophical and ermahgerd. Always hope for a philosophical teacher, so that you can waste half the class talking about really interesting life things that aren't related to Spanish at all.

Geometry is my "sleep-class." Gotten 100% on 4 out of 5 of the tests, with a 91% on the remainder test.

I'm only struggling in English, because I'm a complete perfectionist with my serious works, so I take way too long. Not to mention that I usually have my papers 20% longer than they need to be.
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
Honors Precalculus  —  A+ (98%). Practically a joke. I haven't listened to any lectures in weeks; it's all in the textbook...
Honors Chemistry  —  A+ (96%). I only ever use this period to study and do homework. Pretty basic material.
AP U.S. History  —  A (we're never given our percentages). Easily my least favorite, most technically difficult class.
Advanced Orchestra  —  A+ (100%). Our grade is based off how well we play during fifteen-second excerpt testing.
AP English Language and Composition  —  A (94%). I have the highest grade between all three classes, how sad.
Ceramics  —  A (93%). Either my teacher's gone blind since last semester, or I've gotten slightly less godawful.

That moment when you realize your grades were better when you would always play Nebula until four in the morning...
replies.body_tagged:

AP English Language and Composition  —  A (94%). I have the highest grade between all three classes, how sad.
Ceramics  —  A (93%). Either my teacher's gone blind since last semester, or I've gotten slightly less godawful.

replies.body:
Maths: 6H (Six high) which is above average for my age
English: 5L (Five Low) I am incredibly bad at english :3

PE/Physical Education: No idea xD
Science: 6L (Six middle) Which is far, far above my target level for science which is 5L
Computing: No idea again xD
Technology/DT (Design Technology), FT (Food Technology) ect.: Probably average level 5


 Languages: 4M qui est un niveau décent dans les langues mais je pense moi-même pour être vraiment mauvais au xDDD de langue. I used Google translate xDD

 Geography/Everyday Life: 5L, about average.

Music: No idea, but probably above average because I can play guitar and I have quite a bit of knowledge about music

Art: No idea, but probably around average.

Drama: 4H, but I think to be quite BAD at Drama xD

 Just something that you might find interesting, my favorite subject/topic is astronomy. I love astronomy and just looking at all the stars and planets, it just really interests me, and/also, I really enjoy physics as well as planes, jets and rockets, minecraft .-. and finally, I kinda take interest of maths and music too, especially music. Music is one of the best lessons as well as Drama and art.

 ~ Galrandir

replies.body:
My grades are:

Surf: A+ (100%) - You show up to the beach at 6:00 in the morning, surf, go home, and get ready for school.
Algebra 2: A+ (99%) - Easy stuff, I was made for math.
Biology: A+ (100%) - Lol what science? Nahh, favorite subject right here.
Spanish: C- (73%) - Yeah, I'm BAD at spanish... Too many distractions in this non-accelerated class. (no offense to anyone)
Graphic Design: A+ (101%) - We do the neccessary work, then play on out computers. Pretty damn fun.
English: A (96%) - My most boring class, don't do much in here, and she makes us write 5 page essays due next class... (block schedule).

replies.body:
Well, for the basic classes... 
(Sixth grade in the American education system.)

Pre-Algebra- A -96%- (Taking 8th grade math class because of SOL and IOWA test scores)
History- B+ -89% (End of year, out of steam. Didn't bother to turn in some homework)
Science- A -95% (Like I have to do anything other than take notes)
English- A -93% (80 minutes of torture)
Chorus- A -100%- (As if one could so bad in such a class)
Gym- B+ -88%- (Teacher doesn't bother to put in many grades until end of quarter so....)

replies.body:
2's 3's and little 4's. My school dropped the letter/percent system, and instead uses a set of 10 outcomes per class, that a rubric is based out of. Every assignment/projects based off of different outcomes such as speech. vocabulary and more. It's more dependent on trying than actual unfair marking of specific answer and A to B simplicity. 
1 = proficient 
2= basic
3 = intermediate
4 = above and beyond usual expectation.
